types.section:
{{fr-noun|m}}

# {{lb|fr|maths}} internal instinctive representation of the number of elements of a set, not involving counting, and existing even before language acquisition {{q|compare {{m|en|subitize|subitizing}}}}
types.html:
numéron m (plural numérons)

  1. (mathematics) internal instinctive representation of the number of elements of a set, not involving counting, and existing even before language acquisition (compare subitizing)
trans: internal instinctive representation of the number of elements of a set, not involving counting, and existing even before language acquisition
internal instinctive representation of the number of elements of a set, not involving counting, and existing even before language acquisition

title: numéron
